text: Conditional recommendation low-certainty evidence 13.WHO suggests that women from the general population who have been treated for histologically confirmed CIN2/3 or adenocarcinoma in situ (AIS), or treated as a result of a positive screening test are retested at 12 months with HPV DNA testing when available, rather than with cytology or VlA or co-testing, and, if negative, move to the recommended regular screening interval.
